about_the_game:
"Bring back the lost moments"

STORY
In the 1980s, an unknown corporation develops groundbreaking technology, seemingly impossible for the era. This technology enables the restoration of memories in individuals who are in tragic states, completely eliminating symptoms of Alzheimer's, Parkinson's, or other memory disorders. The corporation is fully funded by the government. They advertise with numerous successful studies over the years. Their reputation is mainly owed to misinformation among people. At that time, this is very possible because the internet or television are not well developed. Their advertising relies on displaying many opinions of families or individuals who managed to restore memory and cure memory disorders. The problem is that it is arranged in a very good way. The government knows everything about it, but there is a lot of corruption in the world, which the corporation and the government exploit and reduce their wealth. The therapy itself costs $40,000 monthly. The corporation in its premium packages for $70,000 per month includes and provides faster therapy and better care for the subject.

Nonetheless, the intentions of the corporation and the government are good, but in the initial stages of technology development, they exploit the misfortune of the subjects' families. The machine in later stages of development is supposed to truly restore memory, but because such technology is simply impossible to achieve at that time, the government and the corporation take advantage of this.

The machine is supposed to work in such a way that it adjusts its operation based on the latest living synapses and neurons. In most cases, the subject is able to respond instinctively by clicking buttons on the machine. At the moment, instead of restoring memory, the machine creates new personalities.

The main character, who is the first subject of the experimental technology, answers tailored questions. Eventually, the questions lead to the protagonist starting to live in the forest and trying to survive away from civilization. They live in seclusion, in a tent, and try to survive. Their new personality is not without side effects such as depression, suicidal thoughts, and sometimes lack of awareness.


SEGMENTS
Identity Test is divided into 3 different segments:
  • DATA ENTRY
  • QUESTION SEGMENT
  • SEGMENT 3D
The story told depends on you and your choices.

KEY FEATURES
  • Memory Restoration Technology: Immerse yourself in a narrative-driven game set in the 1980s, where a revolutionary technology promises to restore memories, challenging your perception of reality.

  • Choices and Consequences: Navigate a complex web of choices as you uncover the truth behind a mysterious corporation, with your decisions shaping the protagonist's fate and the course of the story.

  • Psychological Exploration: Dive deep into the psyche of the protagonist, confronting existential questions and moral dilemmas as you grapple with the consequences of memory manipulation.

  • Compelling Storyline: Unravel a captivating tale of deception, corruption, and personal struggle, with an engaging narrative that keeps you hooked from start to finish.
